nature.title: Failed Harvest
nature.text: The fields yield little this year. The earth has turned stubborn, and even the priests say the gods have turned their eyes away.

nature.title: Drought
nature.text: No rain has fallen for many moons. Wells run dry, and cattle collapse in the dust. Farmers whisper that Poseidon is angry.

nature.title: Earthquake
nature.text: The ground shakes without warning, toppling walls and statues. Some say it is the anger of the earth itself, others that the gods quarrel below.

nature.title: Pestilence of Fields
nature.text: Locusts descend upon the crops, devouring everything green. Offerings are burned day and night, but the swarm only grows.

nature.title: Flood
nature.text: Heavy rains have broken the riverbanks. Homes and granaries lie drowned beneath the muddy waters. Fishermen claim the river spirits are restless.

warfare.title: Border Raids
warfare.text: Bands of armed men from a rival city cross the border. Villages burn before the army can rally.

warfare.title: Rebellion
warfare.text: Discontent stirs within the city. Workers and slaves refuse their duties, claiming the gods favor no longer rests on the rulers.

warfare.title: Siege
warfare.text: Enemy banners appear on the horizon. The city gates are sealed, and food begins to run short as the siege tightens.

warfare.title: Deserters
warfare.text: Soldiers have begun to slip away from the camp at night. Fear and hunger have done what the enemy could not.

warfare.title: Mercenary Betrayal
warfare.text: Hired warriors have turned their spears for better pay. The city’s trust in foreign swords proves costly.

spirit.title: Curse of the Dead
spirit.text: Tombs have been disturbed, and the nights grow uneasy. Some say the dead now walk among the living, seeking what was taken from them.

spirit.title: Blasphemy
spirit.text: A sacred image has been defiled. The priests warn that unless the statue is cleansed, no offering will reach the gods.

spirit.title: Mad Oracle
spirit.text: The city’s oracle speaks only nonsense. Her visions have turned to screams, and pilgrims flee in fear.

spirit.title: Divine Silence
spirit.text: The usual omens have ceased—no birds cry, no flames flicker. The priests worry that the gods have withdrawn their favor entirely.

spirit.title: False Prophet
spirit.text: A man claims to speak with the voice of Apollo. Crowds gather to hear him, but the temple denounces his words as lies.

commerce.title: Market Fire
commerce.text: Flames swept through the market stalls in the night. The air still smells of burnt oil and coin, and trade has halted.

commerce.title: Trade Embargo
commerce.text: A neighboring city has closed its ports to your merchants. Goods rot on ships while diplomats argue at the harbor gates.

commerce.title: Coin Forgery
commerce.text: Fake silver has appeared in the markets. Trust fades quickly, and honest trade suffers with it.

commerce.title: Craftsmen’s Strike
commerce.text: The artisans have laid down their tools, demanding higher pay and better offerings at their guild shrine.

commerce.title: Plague of Rats
commerce.text: Warehouses are overrun with vermin. Grain is spoiled, and merchants fear disease spreading through the docks.
